# Load Packages

```{r}
#| label: load_packages
#| message: false

library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(forcats)
library(here)
library(vcd)
library(RColorBrewer)
```

# Load Cleaned Dataset

```{r}
#| label: load_cleaned_data

load(here("data", "CKL.rda"))
```

# Plotting Descriptive Statistics (Location, Age, and Gender)

## Pick-Up Location / Sending Facility

```{r}
#| label: plot_pickup_location

# Plot the percentage of calls from each pick-up location
CKL_age_groups_pickup_plot <- ggplot(subset(CKL, !is.na(Age_Groups)),
                                    aes(x = fct_infreq(PickupLocationDescription),
                                        y = (after_stat(count)) / sum(after_stat(count)),
                                        fill = Age_Groups)) +
                             geom_bar(position = position_dodge2(preserve = "single")) +
                             scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format(),
                                                breaks = seq(0, 0.2, 0.05))+
                             scale_x_discrete(labels = c("House/Town House" = "House/ \nTown House",
                                                         "Hospital (Acute & Non-Acute)" = "Hospital (Acute \n& Non-Acute)",
                                                         "Apartment/Condo. Building" = "Apartment/ \nCondo. Building",
                                                         "Street/Highway/Road" = "Street/Highway/ \nRoad",
                                                         "Long-Term Care Home" = "Long-Term \nCare Home",
                                                         "Other (Describe in Remarks)" = "Other"))+
                             labs(title = "CKL Drug Toxicity Calls - Pick-Up Location/Sending Facility by Age Group",
                                 y = "Percent of Calls",
                                 x = "Pick-Up Location/Sending Facility",
                                 fill = "Age Groups") +
                             theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45,
                                                              hjust = 1))

# Save the plot as a .png in a separate folder
ggsave(file = here("scripts", "2_descriptive_stats_and_plots", "2_descriptive_statistic_plots_agegroups_CKL", "CKL_pickup_plot_w_agegroup.png"),
       width = 11,
       height = 6)

# Print the plot                   
CKL_age_groups_pickup_plot
```


## Destination / Recieving Facility

```{r}
#| label: plot_destination

# Plot the percentage of calls from each pick-up location
CKL_age_groups_destination_plot <- ggplot(subset(CKL, !is.na(Age_Groups)),
                                          aes(x = fct_infreq(`Receiving Facility/Destination`),
                                              y = after_stat(count) / sum(after_stat(count)),
                                              fill = Age_Groups)) +
                                   geom_bar(position = position_dodge2(preserve = "single")) +
                                   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format(),
                                                      breaks = seq(0, 0.4, 0.05)) +
                                   scale_x_discrete(labels = label_wrap_gen(22))+
                                   labs(title = "CKL Drug Toxicity Calls - Destination/Recieving Facility  by Age Group",
                                       y = "Percent of Calls",
                                       x = "Destination/Recieving Facility",
                                       fill = "Age Groups") +
                                    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45,
                                                                     hjust = 1))

# Save the plot as a .png in a separate folder
ggsave(file = here("scripts", "2_descriptive_stats_and_plots", "2_descriptive_statistic_plots_agegroups_CKL", "CKL_destination_plot_w_agegroup.png"),
       width = 8,
       height = 5)

# Print the plot                   
CKL_age_groups_destination_plot
```

## Gender

```{r}
#| label: plot_gender

# Plot a bar graph to show patient  gender demographics
CKL_age_group_gender_plot <- ggplot(subset(CKL, !is.na(Age_Groups) & !is.na(Gender)),
                              aes(x = Gender,
                              fill = Age_Groups)) + 
                   geom_bar(aes(y = after_stat(count) / sum(after_stat(count))),
                            position = position_dodge2(preserve = "single")) +
                   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent_format(),
                                      breaks = seq(0, 0.35, 0.05)) +
                   scale_x_discrete(label = c("Female", "Male")) +
                   labs(title = "CKL Drug Toxicity Calls - Gender by Age Group",
                        y = "Percentage of Calls",
                        x = "Gender",
                        fill = "Age Groups")

# Save the plot as a .png in a separate folder
ggsave(file = here("scripts", "2_descriptive_stats_and_plots", "2_descriptive_statistic_plots_agegroups_CKL", "CKL_gender_w_agegroup_plot.png"),
       width = 8,
       height = 5)


# Print the plot
CKL_age_group_gender_plot
```

## Age and Gender Mosaic 

```{r}

# Save the plot as a .png in a separate folder
png(filename = here("scripts", "2_descriptive_stats_and_plots", "2_descriptive_statistic_plots_agegroups_CKL", "CKL_agegroup_gender_mosaic.png"),
    width = 8,
    height = 5,
    units = "in",
    res = 300)

agegroup_gender_mosaic <- mosaic(~ Gender + Age_Groups, data = CKL,
                           highlighting = "Age_Groups",
                           highlighting_fill=brewer.pal(6, "Accent"),
                           gp_labels = gpar(fontsize = 5),
                           labeling_args = list(set_varnames = list(Age_Groups = "Age Groups",
                                                                    Gender = "Gender")))

dev.off()
```

# Plotting Descriptive Statistics (Yearly and Monthly Call Counts)

## Calls per Year

```{r}
#| labels: plot_calls_per_year

# Plot the number of calls per year on a bar plot
CKL_call_per_year_w_age_group_barplot <- ggplot(subset(CKL, !is.na(Age_Groups)),
                                                aes(x = factor(Call_Year, levels = 2016:2025),
                                                    fill = Age_Groups)) +
                                         geom_bar(position = position_dodge2(preserve = "single")) +
                                         scale_x_discrete(drop = FALSE) +
                                         labs(title = "Number of CKL Drug Toxicity Calls per Year by Age Group",
                                              x = "Year",
                                              y = "Number of Calls",
                                              fill = "Age Groups")

# Print the bar plot
CKL_call_per_year_w_age_group_barplot

# Save the plot as a .png in a separate folder
ggsave(file = here("scripts", "2_descriptive_stats_and_plots", "2_descriptive_statistic_plots_agegroups_CKL", "CKL_calls_peryear_w_agegroup_barplot.png"),
       width = 9,
       height = 5)
```

## Calls per Month

```{r}
#| labels: plot_calls_per_month
#| warning: false

# Plot the number of calls per month (subsetted by year) on a bar plot
CKL_call_per_month_w_age_group_barplot <- ggplot(subset(CKL, !is.na(Age_Groups)),
                                                aes(x = Call_Month,
                                                    fill = Age_Groups)) +
                                                 geom_bar(position = position_dodge2(preserve = "single")) +
                                                 facet_wrap(factor(Call_Year, levels = 2016:2025)~.,
                                                            drop = FALSE,
                                                            ncol = 2) +
                                                 scale_y_continuous(breaks = seq(0, 20, 5)) +
                                                 labs(title = "Number of CKL Drug Toxicity Calls per Month by Age Group",
                                                      x = "Month",
                                                      y = "Number of Calls",
                                                      fill = "Age Groups")

# Print the bar plot
CKL_call_per_month_w_age_group_barplot

# Save the plot as a .png in a separate folder
ggsave(file = here("scripts", "2_descriptive_stats_and_plots", "2_descriptive_statistic_plots_agegroups_CKL", "CKL_calls_permonth_w_agegroup_barplot.png"),
       width = 11,
       height = 11)
```
